title: The CSO / NPO has a constitution approved by members of the organisation

The Board / Committee meets every quarter (three months) of the year
The CSO / NPO has a documented strategic plan, understood by all staff and used for operational planning
The CSO / NPO has organisational structure for delegating responsibilities

The CSO / NPO has applied for registration with relevant registration authority (NPO Directorate, DTI etc.)
The CSO / NPO is registered with relevant registration authority (NPO Directorate, DTI etc.)

The CSO / NPO submit all documents required to comply with laws applicable to the organisation
The CSO / NPO has interest in becoming a formal organisation operating in its area of work
The organisation understands and knows what community development is
The organisation understands the importance of people’s participation in development
The organisation has understanding of the purpose of community development
The organisation knows the principles of community development
The organisation knows what the values of community development are
The organisation know community development approaches
The organisation understands the importance of commitment of other stakeholders to change
The organisation knows how to build multi-stakeholder partnerships in communities they serve
The organisation has the ability to conduct community situation analysis to inform intervention needed
The organisation know the process of planning for change after conducting situation analysis
The organisation has the experience in mobilizing resources for supporting community projects
The organisation has experience in facilitating implementation of community development programmes
The organisation know what community project monitoring is
The organisation knows reasons for monitoring
The organisation knows the elements of monitoring
The organisation knows what project/programme evaluation is
The organisation knows the barriers to project/programme evaluation
The organisation knows things to consider when taking staff and volunteers
The organisation understands the value of working with volunteers
The organisation knows what is required by volunteers
The organisation has the recruitment and appointment policy for staff and volunteers
organisation has a checklist for conducting job interviews
The organisation has templates for employment and volunteer’s contracts
Management has provided a common definition of conflict for the organisation
The organisation has developed a common understanding of conflict for the organisation
The organisation has knowledge of the sources of conflict
The organisation has knowledge about the effects of conflict on the organisation’s work
The organisation has developed a common understanding of types of conflict
The organisation has developed a common understanding of conflict
The organisation’s members and staff know the different categories of conflict
The organisation know the functions of conflict
The organisation knows the two dimensions of cause-and-effect relationship between conflict and human rights
The organisation knows the different ways in which the two dimensions between conflict and human rights are connected
The organisation knows that the protection and promotion of human rights is essential to the management of conflict
The organisation has understanding of conflict resolution
The organisation has knowledge about the methods of conflict resolution
The organisation has the two important skills in effective communication
The organisation has knowledge of the characteristics of communication behaviour
The organisation has active listening skills
The organisation has negotiation skills
The organisation has mediation skills
The organisation has accounting system (standards, policies, records and reporting), functions, and is supported with written procedures and guidelines
The organisation has approved budget and expenditures statements monitored every month
The organisation managers and programme supervisors receive financial information on expenses and income, and are used to make programme decisions for which they are accountable
The organisation accounting system(s) can segregate the costs (general ledger codes) of delivering each main service/product
The organisation has an adequate financial and inventory controls system and is implemented
The organisation has systems and processes for financial and budgeting controls for managing risks and expenditure outcomes
The organisation has budgeting process and integrated into annual operating planning
Organisation staff members are responsible for preparation, management and implementation of project budgets
The organisation conduct annual financial audit every year for annual financial reporting and transparency
The organisation produces donor performance and financial reports as per contracts or agreements
The organisation always include administrative costs in its budget for donor funding
The organisation open separate accounts for different donors
The organisation has policies, procedures and systems for procurement of goods and services
The organisation has systems and procedures for keeping financial records (quotations, invoices, cheques,petty cash slips etc)
The organisation has a qualified staff member responsible for financial and procurement functions
The organisation has an electronic system for its accounting and financial management
The board/executive committee provides overall policy direction and oversight
The board/Executive Committee provides accountability and credibility
The board/executive committee is composed of committed members who represent varied interests of the constituency
The board/executive committee is capable of carrying out key roles such as policy formulation, planning and reporting fundraising, public relations and lobbying
The organisation mission and goal are clearly defined
The organisation strategies are aligned with mission and are realistic
The organisation strategic planning is jointly conducted by the board, management and staff with input from other stakeholders
Board and management have a clear understanding of their roles and responsibilities as providers of overall direction
Management’s relationship with staff is participatory and transparent
Management decisions are communicated and delegated to lower levels of organisation
Leadership is accessible and fosters staff participation
The organisation has succession plan for key managers and staff
The board / executive committee meets regularly
The board / executive committee has representative from people with disabilities, women and young people
The organisation has a selection criteria for its board / executive members
The organisation constitution clearly defined term of office and limit to the number of times a board /executive committee member for re-election
The organisation is registered in terms of Non-Profit Organisations (NPO) Act or cooperative Act
The organisation have evidence of registration in the form of registration documentation
The organisation knows all its obligations as a registered NPO or Cooperative in South Africa
The organisation know that members, board and staff follow due process to benefit from the assets and resources
The organisation keeps records of its income, expenditure, assets and liabilities
The organisation keeps records of annual reports (narrative report and financial statements)
The organisation sends annual narrative report in a prescribed format within nine (9) months of financial year end to the Department of Social Development (DSD) or Members of the Cooperative

The organisation sends annual financial statement (consisting of income and expenditure; balance sheet; accounting officer’s report) within nine (9) months of financial year end to the Department of Social Development (DSD) or members of the Cooperative

Every year after the end of financial year of the organisation, if there has been changes in the constitution, the organisation sends the DSD or members of the Cooperative minutes of the meeting signed by all members and the amended constitution
The organisation knows that failure to submit annually documents for compliance with the law and registration status can result in the de-registration or and prosecution
The organisation knows that it is an offence to make material false representation in annual narrative and financial reports
The organisation knows that it is an offence to use a de-registered organisation or cooperative number when doing its business
The organisation knows that it is an offence to represent an organisation as being registered when it is not

The organisation knows how to appeal against refusal to register or de-registration of an organisation with the relevant registration authorities (NPO Directorate or Registrar of Company Intellectual Property Commission (CIPC))
The organisational structure clearly defines lines of authority and responsibilities
The organisation has systems to collect, analyse and disseminate data and information
The organisation base its decisions on data and information
The organisation has open communication and feedback mechanisms
The organisation has operation plans, reviewed, updated and reflect a strategic plan
The organisation involve staff in the development of operational plan
The organisation resources are planned for and allocated to specific activities
The organisation include input from constituents is its operational planning process
The organisation has a monitoring and evaluation system and outputs are used by the organisation
The organisation produces monthly operational reports and are used to inform stakeholders on its operations results
The organisation produces lessons learn or evaluation reports about its operations
The organisation has operations guidelines and tools for implementation of programmes
The organisation has service quality guidelines for its products and services
The organisation has a system to calculate unit cost per benefit/client for its services or products
The organisation has a clearly defined recruitment, employment and personnel policy
The organisation has internal regulations governing staff rights and obligations (working hours, benefits, discipline and codes of conduct, etc) and comply with SA labour legislation.
The organisation has well defined staff job descriptions, documented and respected and updated every time there are changes
The organisation staff participate in management decision
The organisation staff members are encouraged to make suggestions and to share ideas to improve organisational performance
The organisation promote team work to improve organisation performance
The organisation promote information sharing among all staff members
The organisation regularly conduct staff performance appraisals to assess staff capacity needs
The organisation has staff performance indicators and are used to evaluate their performance
The organisation has systems to reward staff on outcome of performance
